snippet: The Treasury Department said on Tuesday that it had sold an additional $2.7 billion worth of its holdings in A.I.G., as underwriters for the offering exercised what's known as an overallotment option to meet higher-than-expected demand.
abstract: The Treasury Department said on Tuesday that it had sold an additional $2.7 billion worth of its holdings in A.I.G., as underwriters for the offering exercised what's known as an overallotment option to meet higher-than-expected demand.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Treasury Sells Additional $2.7 Billion Worth of A.I.G. Shares
